results.title: Any time, any place
results.brief_description: This documentary presented by the United States National Parks Service, expresses concern that man has become separate from nature. While many humans still exist as they did centuries ago, modern man has built a wall against nature. Calls for teaching to inspire and regain an interest in nature. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: Any questions?
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions, Victorian Film Corporation and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the problems of generating group discussions. After completing a complicated explanation, a trainer asks questions of the group. In his despair at failing to elicit questions he jumps out the window.

results.title: Any friends or relations
results.brief_description: A tractor safety film which investigates the many kinds of accidents which can happen. Shows how the operator’s personal failures can cause accidents. Gives valuable safety hints on the operation of tractors. Suitable for rural and construction

results.title: Any empty space
results.brief_description: Records the evolution of the Northwestern University Mime Company from its initial orientation to its first performance. The company consists of students who had no previous training in the art. The film also reveals the kinds of mental and physical discipline demanded by mime as an art form. No other credits available.

results.title: Ants
results.brief_description: Varied activities of four different types of ants; mound builders, black ants, household ants, and carpenter ants. Shows in detail the life cycle of the carpenter ant, including construction of the nest, laying of eggs, feeding of young , hatching, and preparations for swarming. Intercolony battle between mound builders and food ants.

results.title: Antony Gormley [Widescreen]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TheEYE”.
Part of a series of interview-based profiles of contemporary visual artists in Britain - this episode focuses on Antony Gormley, an artist who focuses on the body, the connections between mind, body and spirit, and the links between metaphysical issues and his art. Internationally acclaimed, Gormley’s best-known work is “Angel of the north” (1998) - this earth bound figure with its massive wings shares with all of Gormley’s work his concerns with the miraculous, interrogating notions of religion and the assimilation of divine attributes into the modern world. Early lead and iron figures were cast from Gormley’s own body; later works of babies and children were inspired by fatherhood; both periods raise profound philosophical questions about memory, the mind and our senses. In an illuminating interview Gormley discusses the many humanistic issues that concern him, addressed through his art.

results.title: Antony and Cleopatra (Perspective)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Shakespeare in Perspective Series”.
Designed to give a greater understanding and appreciation of the play by placing it in its social and historical context and by stressing its relevance for a modern-day audience. Perspective offered by Anna Raeburn, journalist and television personality.

results.title: Antonio Gaudi: to a dancing god
results.brief_description: Filmed in Barcelona, this program is an examination of the Art Nouveau architecture and philosophy of Spanish architect, Antonio Gaudi. It takes a retrospective look at his work, exploring the strong, sure buildings, churches and mosaics that were his masterpiece. This film was submitted by Theo Mathews as his thesis for an Associateship in Architecture at the Western Australian Institute of Technology. Suitable for Middle-Upper Secondary students.
